title: Ronsbit
author: Ronsbit
content: Good day all. I am Ronsbit and new onboard this platform. I have gone through most board here and I have read through to see some rules and regulations. I am also looking to investing in bitcoin and as well spread the word of bitcoin to my peers and everyone around me who cares and pick interest in bitcoin buy I would also need some advice here on how to go about it which I believe there are some good Samaritan here that can guide me through to achieving it and making my stay here  meaningful in contributing my quota of existence on this platform.I will appreciate your opinions, directions and lots more politely.Thank you.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: First go through your learning journey before you attempt to teach Bitcoin to others.Trying to teach someone about Bitcoin without understanding it yourself could lead you to give wrong and inaccurate information which could cost them funds.Quote from: Ronsbit on February 19, 2023, 03:18:15 PMguide me through to achieving it and making my stay here  meaningful in contributing my quota of existence on this platform.Keep to the rules and you would have contributed more than 90% of users here.As for guidance; read through the plethora of posts available here and pick topics that interests you.

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: Hello and welcome to the forum, there is a lot to learn and not only about bitcoin, you can learn about this grat community...You should start by looking for the forum rules and learning about the forum ranks, to grow up your account you need to be active and to get merits, and if things go fine then you will be a legendary member in less than 3 years. So, if you have any questions just let us know and we will help you.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: Ronsbit on February 19, 2023, 03:18:15 PMI have gone through most board here and I have read through to see some rules and regulations.You're half way through the regular unforseen problems that most users have here – that's not going through the rules of engagement here until they're trapped. You started well by doing that. I don't know if you stumbled on this forum like I did or you were directed here by a friend or loved one. If the latter was your case; then I believe they must've told you that this forum sticks to its rules. It's a strict place to be if you're someone who doesn't like keeping to rules. All the same, just feel free to make concise and constructive contributions to issues here. By that you will be adding to the growth of this forum.QuoteI would also need some advice here on how to go about it which I believe there are some good Samaritan here that can guide me through to achieving it and making my stay here  meaningful in contributing my quota of existence on this platform.I will appreciate your opinions, directions and lots more politely.Thank you.While I ain't a fan of people asking to be mentored here, l want to tell you to avoid anyone sending you pms asking you to subscribe to their channels or whatever. Most often such leads to scam. Beware.

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: Rules and regulations are what guide any organization and this forum is no different. A commendable step you took by grasping that knowledge. Well just as the OGs have opined, constant(meaningful) contribution to the forum would help you grow and since you cannot give what you don't have, it's best to have an in-depth knowledge of Bitcoin; not just here alone but also from personal researches as that too will help you better enjoy the forum. Welcome on board, bruh.

comments.author: akuntester1
comments.body: Quote from: Ronsbit on February 19, 2023, 03:18:15 PMGood day all. I am Ronsbit and new onboard this platform. I have gone through most board here and I have read through to see some rules and regulations. I am also looking to investing in bitcoin and as well spread the word of bitcoin to my peers and everyone around me who cares and pick interest in bitcoin buy I would also need some advice here on how to go about it which I believe there are some good Samaritan here that can guide me through to achieving it and making my stay here  meaningful in contributing my quota of existence on this platform.I will appreciate your opinions, directions and lots more politely.Thank you.Hi Ronsbit, welcome to this forum.It's a good step to join because here we will get a lot of basic knowledge, insights and views from forum members from various countries in the world.Just making sure you've read and understood the sticky threads and important threads in this forum, I hope you've read them too:Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQNewbies - Read before postingBecause I think it's very important to know and comply with the rules of this forum to avoid unwanted mistakes in this forum.And it's important to know how we contribute actively and constructively in this forum.If you want to know Bitcoin, always take the time to always add to your insight before you share your knowledge with others.May I suggest reading Whitepaper Bitcoin to add to your reading.Before investing maybe you also need a wallet that matches the device you have to store your assets, here's a sticky thread about the wallet that has been embedded [General] Bitcoin Wallets - Which, what, why?We wish you success in the future with your Bitcoin investment journey and hopefully you can contribute actively and constructively to this forum.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Do you want some hard truth? No one would guide you hand by hand on your journey here, it is going to be very difficult for that to happen, it’s up to you to find someone you can consider as a mentor and if you have any questions you can ask, but mind you some people don’t like to be pressured.About your investment, well it’s up to you, after you have done your research and checked how your capital can carry, and finally about advising your peers, please put that on hold and first learn before you would know how what to tell them.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: I don't have to say more to you but what I will tell you is that take some time to read the forum carefully and as I have gone through your profile, you are just a beginner who needs to spend time reading the forum and know more principles of bitcoin before investing your resources into bitcoin.Don't be too haste to venture into bitcoin without making proper investigation, and know to well there are rules and regulations that follows investment. As always said, invest with what you could afford to lose or invest with spare funds.

comments.author: I_Anime
comments.body: Welcome to bitcointalk this is the best Forum to learn anything about bitcoin and others. You definitely will enjoy your stay here if your desire is to contribute and learn on this Forum.In Investing in bitcoin you either mining or trading This site can be you get started about bitcoin and mining bitcoin https://www.nerdwallet.com/article/investing/what-is-bitcoin

comments.author: Emitdama
comments.body: Quote from: akuntester1 on February 19, 2023, 06:36:28 PMIt's a good step to join because here we will get a lot of basic knowledge, insights and views from forum members from various countries in the world.Just making sure you've read and understood the sticky threads and important threads in this forum, I hope you've read them too:Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQNewbies - Read before postingBecause I think it's very important to know and comply with the rules of this forum to avoid unwanted mistakes in this forum.And it's important to know how we contribute actively and constructively in this forum.If you want to know Bitcoin, always take the time to always add to your insight before you share your knowledge with others.May I suggest reading Whitepaper Bitcoin to add to your reading.Before investing maybe you also need a wallet that matches the device you have to store your assets, here's a sticky thread about the wallet that has been embedded [General] Bitcoin Wallets - Which, what, why?We wish you success in the future with your Bitcoin investment journey and hopefully you can contribute actively and constructively to this forum.You almost got it covered, but here are a couple of more resources that could be useful for OP as a beginner:1. Forum ranks/positions/badges (What do those shiny coins under my name mean?)2. FAQ: Everything you need to know about forum 'activity, account ranks and merit@OP, if you are interested in investing in Bitcoin, I would suggest you to do some research on things like what's the best exchange as per your preferences, like if you got no problem with KYC, you can go for centralized exchanges like Binance, or you can choose any other exchange comparing their fees and everything. You should easily be able to find all that information with a simple Google search.

comments.author: Babamann
comments.body: You pay attention to the guidelines and rules, and you also are aware of the types of people who will support you and help you succeed. You also learn not to give in to weakness or discouragement no matter how difficult anything may seem to you.I'm a novice who is having some difficulty, but I'm determined to persevere until I reach my goal.

comments.author: JoyMarsha
comments.body: Welcome on board Ronsbit. Reading the guidelines for this forum does not give you a start in investing in bitcoin or educating your friends about bitcoin. The forum is not only about the rule and regulations, as you recently learned. There is so much exposure to crypto that this forum offers. In case you don't know, bitcoin investment and the forum policies are two completely distinct things.If all you can think of when you don't have the necessary knowledge of bitcoin is investing and raising awareness of it, you're off to the incorrect start.Take your time to comprehend what bitcoin is all about before investing in it if you are unfamiliar with how the crypto market functions.
